definition[0]: affecting many things, or making an important difference to something
example[0]: They want to make sweeping changes to education policies.
definition[1]: including a lot of information about something
example[1]: a sweeping look at European history
example[2]: the sweeping curve of the driveway
definition[3]: sweeping changes, cuts etc affect many people and make a big difference
example[4]: The multinational announced asweeping reorganization of its trading and investment arm.
example[5]: The firm has taken sweeping steps to tackle its operating problems.
